projectPurpose: To provide a lightweight client implementation for the Avail network, primarily focused on verifying data availability on the Avail Data Availability (DA) layer using Data Availability Sampling (DAS) without requiring a full node.
mainFeatures: Verifies data availability without a full node
Connects to the Avail peer-to-peer network
Provides API for querying block and application data

alternatives.name: Celestia Light Node
mainFeatures: Verifies data availability on Celestia's DA network
Contributes to network security via DAS

alternatives.name: Ethereum Light Clients (e.g., Lodestar)
mainFeatures: Relies on data from full nodes
Uses cryptographic methods for verification (e.g., sync committees)
Significantly lower resource requirements than full nodes

alternatives.name: Bitcoin SPV Client
mainFeatures: Relies on connecting to full nodes
Lower resource usage than full nodes

marketPositioning: The avail-light client is positioned as a key component of the Avail modular blockchain ecosystem, specifically focused on providing trust-minimized and resource-efficient verification of data availability on the Avail DA layer. Its core strength lies in leveraging Data Availability Sampling (DAS) and erasure coding, offering security guarantees comparable to full nodes with minimal computational overhead. This distinguishes it from more general light clients and positions Avail as a specialized data availability layer enabling scalable and modular blockchain architectures. It competes directly with other modular data availability layers like Celestia and offers an alternative approach to data verification compared to traditional blockchain light clients.
